resources.string: Basketlly
Let me in
WELCOME TO BASKETLLY
“I’ve never lost a game, I just ran out of time.” ― Michael Jordan
“Every memory I had growing up was involving a basketball. I didn’t go to the prom and stuff like that. It was always basketball for me.” ― Kevin Durant
“Be a dreamer. If you don’t know how to dream, you’re dead.” ― Jim Valvano
“When you’re not practicing, someone else is getting better.” ― Allen Iverson
“Hard work beats talent when talent fails to work hard.” ― Kevin Durant
“All the successful teams I’ve ever seen have three characteristics: they play unselfish, they play together, and they play hard.” ― Larry Brown
“Keep practicing. Never let anyone tell you’re too small or too slow.” ― Chris Paul
“The two ingredients in success in basketball are playing hard and playing intelligently.” ― Pete Carroll.
“I always laugh when people ask me about rebounding techniques. I’ve got a technique. It’s called just go get ball.” ― Charles Barkley
“Me shooting 40% at the foul line is just God’s way to say nobody’s perfect.” ― Shaquille O’Neal
“Don’t let winning make you soft. Don’t let losing make you quit. Don’t let your teammates down in any situation.” ― Larry Bird
“I really get motivated when I have doubters.” — Shaquille O’Neal
“I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.” ― Michael Jordan
“Never give up. Failure and rejection are just the first steps to succeeding.”― Jim Valvano
“Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence wins championships.” ― Michael Jordan
“A team will always appreciate a great individual if he’s willing to sacrifice for the group.” ― Kareem Abdul Jabbar
“The important thing is that your teammates have to know you’re pulling for them and you really want them to be successful.” ― Kobe Bryant
“A strong leader accepts blame and gives the credit. A weak leader gives blame and accepts the credit.” ― John Wooden
“The game has its ups and downs, but you can never lose focus of your individual goals and you can’t let yourself be beat because of lack of effort.” ― Michael Jordan
“Starting today, you will play like winners, act like winners, and most importantly, you will be winners.” ‒ Coach Ken Carter

“The board sent the message loud and clear. Winning basketball games is more important than graduating from high school and going to college. I’m sorry, I just can’t support that message.” ― Coach Ken Carter
“Since when is winning not enough? Playing hard not enough?” ― Coach Ken Carter
“And, I promise you, I will do everything in my power to get you to college and a better life.” ― Coach Ken Carter

“Some of my teammates went to prison. Some of them ended up dead. I took this job because I wanted to effect change in a special group of young men, and this is the only way that I know how to do that.” ― Coach Ken Carter

“If you endorse the fact that fifteen, sixteen, seventeen year-old boys cannot honor the simple rules of a basketball contract, how long do you think it’ll be before they’re out there breaking laws?” ― Coach Ken Carter

“Now, I want you to go home and look at your lives tonight and look at your parents’ lives and ask yourself, ‘Do I want better?’ If the answer is yes, I will see you here tomorrow.” ― Coach Ken Carter
“We control the tempo of the game. We make them play Richmond Oiler ball.” ― Coach Ken Carter
“Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure” ― Timo Cruz
“You said we’re a team. One person struggles, we all struggle. One person triumphs, we all triumph.” ― Jason Lyle
